column5: Sounds like i have to try Kab, sounds nice. I can second Mille lacs, caught a bunch there last year. Also I just love Cass lake, not a walleye factory like Mille lacs but there is a decent population there.

Mn DNR has a lake finder site for many, many lakes in the state that have fish survey results for most....some surveys are a little old, but they give a look at what DNR has found in the lakes....e.g., some have a lot of walleyes, some have none, same wither species. I haven't checked big border lakes.

I had a great adventure planned for my Wife, Daughter and myself for early June in Canada. Found out today that trip is a bust. We still have our plane reservations and a hotel night coming and going reserved with no chance of changing those. Thought we might just head up to a Minnesota based walleye fishing camp. Can you guys recommend a place within a couple hours of Int. Falls? And maybe a guide if needed??? Thanks.
Rainy lake on the US side is real good.
Kabtogama just south of IF. Lake vermilion. Crane lake all in that area can be good.
Lake of the Woods MN side several resorts
Mille Lacs is open for walleye until July 1st. If you like catching, don't overlook this lake. If releasing is hard, look elsewhere. Still a great walleye lake in MN.Sent from my iPad using Tapatalk

Call a few of the resorts on Lake Kabetogama. The one we go to had a couple of cancellations (Covid and travel related), so gave us a sweet deal if we would extend our stay. Usually everything is booked that time of year, but you may very well find a few openings for your dates. Beautiful lake, and the State restrictions on guides just got lifted, so there may be openings there too. Likely there will be none that have any kind of meals due to Covid, so you will have to bring your own food/supplies, but the groceries in the Falls are open, and most places have kitchens with everything you need.
We got into a cabin on Kab today by the skin of our teeth. Looking forward to it. Fished there for years a long time ago. Very pristine place and looks "just like" Ontario LOL!

For a guide on lake of the woods talk with lake of the woods outdoorsman. He may help with a place to stay also. Great guy. We stay on the Canada side. I forgot when I recomend lakes that there's a big area in Minnesota.
I also had to cancel my trip to lac seul and booked with Grandview resort on kab...will be there June 6th-13th...3rd time staying there in 4 years...great people
